lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Prime.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Prime.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Welcome to **Prime**, your intelligent task management assistant!
Prime helps you add, manage, and find your tasks efficiently.
A todo task will be added to the task list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in your task list.
Add a deadline task, a task that has to be completed by a certain deadline
A deadline task will be added to the task list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in your task list.
Add an event task, a task that has both start and end date/time
An event task will be added to the task list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in your task list.
List all the current tasks in the task list with their respective status.
All tasks in the task list is shown
Here are your tasks in your list:
Ticking a task as completed by specifying its number in the list command.
The marked task is marked as done `[X]`
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unticking a task as not completed by specifying its number in the list command.
The unmarked task is marked as not done `[ ]`
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
## Command 7: Finding Tasks using a Keyword
Finding tasks in the task list that contains a specific keyword entered by the user
All tasks' description containing the keyword will be listed
Here are the matching tasks from the list:
Delete a task by specifying its number in the list command.
The specified task will be deleted
Got it. I've deleted this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in your task list.
Bye Human, I wish you a nice day. Hope to see you again soon!
* The entry point of the Prime Task Management application.
* This class initializes the necessary components (UI, task manager, parser),
* handles user input, executes commands, and manages the application loop
* until the user issues an exit command.
* The main method that starts the Prime application.
* It initializes the user interface, task manager, and input scanner.
* The application runs in a loop until the user chooses to exit.
* Represents a command to exit the Prime application.
* When executed, it prints a goodbye message to the user and signals
* Constructs a new {@code ByeCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments (ignored for this command)
* Executes the command by displaying the goodbye message via {@link UserInterface}.
* @param ui          the user interface to display the goodbye message
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) {
* Indicates that this command will exit the application.
* @return {@code true} always, signaling the application to terminate
* Abstract base class representing a user command in the Prime task management system.
* Each concrete subclass corresponds to a specific command type, such as
* Constructs a new {@code Command} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the arguments provided by the user
* Returns the raw arguments of this command.
* Executes this command using the provided {@link TaskManager} and {@link UserInterface}.
* Concrete subclasses must implement this method to perform the actual command logic.
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if any error occurs during command execution
public abstract void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException;
* Returns the type of this command.
* Returns whether this command should exit the program.
* Defaults to {@code false}. Commands like {@code ByeCommand} should override
* @return {@code true} if the command causes the application to exit, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents a command to add a {@link Deadline} task to the task list.
* The command requires a description and a deadline time (/by).
* If either field is missing or empty, the corresponding exception
* Constructs a new {@code DeadlineCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the full argument string containing description and /by
* Executes the command by parsing the deadline details and adding a new
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the input format is invalid or any required field is empty
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Invalid deadline format! Use: deadline [desc] /by [time]");
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* The command requires a task number as an argument. If the task number
* is invalid or cannot be parsed, a {@link PrimeException} is thrown.
* Constructs a new {@code DeleteCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments, expected to be the task number
* Executes the command by deleting the specified task from the {@link TaskManager}.
* @param taskManager the task manager containing all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the task number is invalid or cannot be parsed
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Please enter a valid number");
* Represents a command to add an {@link Event} task to the task list.
* The command requires a description, a start time (/from), and an end time (/to).
* If any of these fields are missing or empty, the corresponding exception
* Constructs a new {@code EventCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the full argument string containing description, /from, and /to
* Executes the command by parsing the event details and adding a new
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the input format is invalid or any required field is empty
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Invalid event format! Use: event [desc] /from [start] /to [end]");
* Represents a command to find tasks that match a given keyword.
* Searches through all tasks in the {@link TaskManager} and displays
* the matching tasks via the {@link UserInterface}.
* Constructs a new {@code FindCommand} with the specified search keyword.
* @param arguments the search keyword to find in task descriptions
* Executes the find command by searching for tasks containing the keyword
* @param taskManager the task manager containing all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display matching tasks
* @throws PrimeException if no search term is provided
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Please provide a search term!");
ui.printIndented("Here are the matching tasks from the list: ");
* Represents a command that is invalid or unrecognized by the Prime system.
* When executed, this command always throws an {@link InvalidCommandException}.
* Constructs a new {@code InvalidCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments (ignored for this command)
* Executes the command by throwing an {@link InvalidCommandException}.
* @throws PrimeException always thrown to indicate the command is invalid
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
* Represents a command to list all tasks in the task list.
* This command does not require any arguments. When executed,
* it displays all current tasks via the {@link UserInterface}.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments (ignored for this command)
* Executes the command by listing all tasks in the {@link TaskManager}.
* @param taskManager the task manager containing all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display the tasks
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed (done) in the task list.
* The command requires a task number as an argument. If the task number
* is invalid or cannot be parsed, a {@link PrimeException} is thrown.
* Constructs a new {@code MarkCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments, expected to be the task number
* Executes the command by marking the specified task as done in the {@link TaskManager}.
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the task number is invalid or cannot be parsed
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Please enter a valid task number!");
* Represents a command to add a {@link ToDo} task to the task list.
* The command requires a non-empty description. If the description
* is empty, an {@link EmptyDescriptionException} is thrown.
* Constructs a new {@code TodoCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the description of the ToDo task
* Executes the command by creating a new {@link ToDo} task and adding it
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the description is empty or adding the task fails
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
* Represents a command to mark a task as not done (unmark).
* This command requires the user to provide a task number as an argument.
* Constructs a new {@code UnmarkCommand} with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments the user-provided arguments, expected to be the task number
* Executes the unmark operation on the given {@link TaskManager}.
* Marks the specified task as not done and displays feedback through
* @param taskManager the task manager handling all tasks
* @param ui          the user interface to display messages
* @throws PrimeException if the task number is invalid or cannot be parsed
public void execute(TaskManager taskManager, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
throw new PrimeException("Please enter a valid task number!");
* Exception thrown when the {@code /by} field of a command is empty.
* Typically used for {@code Deadline} tasks where the deadline time is required
* but not provided by the user.
* Constructs a new {@code EmptyByException} with a detailed message
* specifying the type of command that triggered the exception.
* @param commandType the type of command (e.g., Deadline) that caused the exception
super("OOPS!!! The /by of " + commandType.toString() + " cannot be empty");
* Exception thrown when the description of a command is empty.
* Typically used for tasks like {@code ToDo}, {@code Deadline}, or {@code Event}
* when the user does not provide a description.
* Constructs a new {@code EmptyDescriptionException} with a detailed message
* specifying the type of command that caused the exception.
* @param commandType the type of command (e.g., ToDo, Deadline, Event) that triggered the exception
super("OOPS!!! The description of " + commandType.toString() + " cannot be empty.");
* Exception thrown when the {@code /from} field of a command is empty.
* Typically used for {@code Event} tasks where the start time is required
* but not provided by the user.
* Constructs a new {@code EmptyFromException} with a detailed message
* specifying the type of command that triggered the exception.
* @param commandType the type of command (e.g., Event) that caused the exception
super("OOPS!!! The /from of " + commandType.toString() + " cannot be empty");
* Exception thrown when the {@code /to} field of a command is empty.
* Typically used for {@code Event} tasks where the end time is required
* but not provided by the user.
* Constructs a new {@code EmptyToException} with a detailed message
* specifying the type of command that triggered the exception.
* @param commandType the type of command (e.g., Event) that caused the exception
super("OOPS!!! The /to of " + commandType.toString() + " cannot be empty");
* Exception thrown when a user enters a command that is not recognized
* by the Prime task management system.
* Constructs a new {@code InvalidCommandException} with a default
* detailed message explaining that the command is invalid.
super("Invalid command Human! You are asking me to do stuff I have not been programmed to do");
* Exception thrown when a user provides an invalid task number.
* The invalid task number is either less than 1 or greater than the
* maximum number of tasks allowed in the task list.
* Constructs a new {@code InvalidTaskNumberException} with a detailed message
* specifying the invalid task number and the allowed range.
* @param taskNo the invalid task number provided by the user
* @param max    the maximum number of tasks allowed in the task list
super("Invalid task number of " + taskNo + "! Please try again." +
"\n    You are allowed to enter a number between 1 and " + max);
* Represents a generic exception specific to the Prime task management system.
* Serves as the base class for all custom exceptions in the application,
* Constructs a new {@code PrimeException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message to describe the exception
* Manages the list of tasks for the application.
* Handles task creation, deletion, marking/unmarking, searching,
* and persistence through the {@link Storage} class.
* Provides interaction feedback through the {@link UserInterface}.
* Loads existing tasks from storage into the internal task list.
* Adds a new task to the task list if the maximum task limit is not reached.
* @param ui   the user interface to display feedback
* @throws PrimeException if the maximum task limit is reached
public void addTask(Task task, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
ui.printIndented("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.printIndented("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in your task list.");
throw new PrimeException("Task list is full Human! Maybe it’s time you finish some tasks.");
* Deletes a task from the task list by its task number.
* @param taskNo the task number (1-based index) to delete
* @param ui     the user interface to display feedback
* @throws PrimeException if the task number is invalid
public void deleteTask(int taskNo, UserInterface ui) throws PrimeException {
ui.printIndented("Got it. I've deleted this task:");
ui.printIndented("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in your task list.");
* Displays all tasks in the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to display feedback
ui.printIndented("No tasks have been added in your list yet.");
ui.printIndented("Here are your tasks in your list:");
* @param taskIndex the task index (1-based) to mark as done
* @param ui        the user interface to display feedback
public void markTask(int taskIndex, UserInterface ui) {
ui.printIndented("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks a task as not completed.
* @param taskIndex the task index (1-based) to unmark as done
* @param ui        the user interface to display feedback
public void unmarkTask(int taskIndex, UserInterface ui) {
ui.printIndented("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Finds tasks that contain the given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for (case-insensitive)
* @return a list of tasks that match the search
* Parses user input and generates the corresponding {@code Command} objects
* for execution in the Prime Task Management system.
* The {@code Parser} supports parsing of commands such as {@code todo},
* Parses the full user input and returns the corresponding {@code Command}.
* @param userInput The full input string entered by the user.
* @return A {@code Command} object representing the parsed instruction.
* @throws PrimeException If the input cannot be parsed into a valid command.
public static Command parse(String userInput) throws PrimeException {
// Split out the command word and the arguments using the Regex for space
* Parses the arguments for a deadline task into description and deadline time.
* @param arguments The raw string containing the task description and {@code /by} token.
* @return A string array where index 0 is the description and index 1 is the deadline,
* or {@code null} if the {@code /by} token is missing.
* Parses the arguments for an event task into description, start time, and end time.
* @param arguments The raw string containing the task description and {@code /from} and {@code /to} tokens.
* @return A string array where index 0 is the description, index 1 is the start time,
* and index 2 is the end time, or {@code null} if either token is missing.
* Handles persistent storage of tasks for the Prime Task Management system.
* The {@code Storage} class is responsible for saving tasks to a file and
* loading tasks back into memory. Tasks are stored in a plain text file
* The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* The UI instance used for displaying messages to the user.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* If the file or its parent directory does not exist, they will be created.
* @return A list of {@code Task} objects loaded from the file.
* Saves tasks to the storage file.
* @param tasks The list of {@code Task} objects to save.
* Converts a line from the storage file into a {@code Task} object.
* Supports parsing of ToDo, Deadline, and Event task formats.
* Returns {@code null} if the line is malformed or cannot be parsed.
* @param line The line of text to parse.
* @return A {@code Task} object, or {@code null} if parsing fails.
Event e = new Event(desc, from, to);
* Converts a {@code Task} object into a formatted string
* suitable for saving to the storage file.
* @return A string representation of the task for file storage.
* Represents a deadline task in the task management system.
* A deadline task contains a description and a specific due date/time
* The deadline (due date/time) for the task.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date/time for the task.
* Returns the string representation of the deadline task,
* including its type, completion status, description, and deadline.
* @return A formatted string representation of the deadline task.
* Returns the deadline (due date/time) of the task.
* Represents an event task in the task management system.
* An event task contains a description and a time range defined by
* a start time ({@code from}) and an end time ({@code to}).
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the given description and time range.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the string representation of the event task,
* including its type, completion status, description, and time range.
* @return A formatted string representation of the event task.
return "[E]" + getTickUnTickIcon() + " " + super.description + " (from: " + this.from + " to: " + this.to + ")";
* Returns the start time of the event.
* @return The start time as a string.
* Returns the end time of the event.
* @return The end time as a string.
* Represents a generic task in the task management system.
* This is an abstract class that can be extended by specific task types
* such as ToDo, Deadline, or Event.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* By default, the task is not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Sets the completion status of the task.
* @param isDone true if the task is completed, false otherwise.
* Returns a tick or untick icon representing the task's status.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" otherwise.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* This currently returns only the description.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Represents a to-do task in the task management system.
* A to-do task contains only a description with no specific deadline or time range.
* Constructs a {@code ToDo} task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Returns the string representation of the to-do task,
* including its type, completion status, and description.
* @return A formatted string representation of the to-do task.
* Handles all user interactions in the Prime Task Management system.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages, prompts, and responses
* to the user in a consistent, formatted style.
// Helps auto indent 4 spaces to show the Bot Response
printIndented("Freedom is the right of all sentient beings.");
printIndented("How may I assist you in protecting our shared world today?");
printIndented("Bye Human, I wish you a nice day. Hope to see you again soon!");
